page.title: 01REVIEW OF CHADDESLEY CORBETT
page.content: The area surrounding Chaddesley Corbett consists of farms and a large area of woodland. A road joins smaller villages to the largest one, Chaddesley Corbett, this road joins the main Kidderminster to Bromsgrove road at the entrance to the village of Chaddesley Corbett. The village has a church, 3 public houses, doctors surgery, a voluntary aided school, several alms houses, 3 shops, a hairdressers, and a village hall which is used for social activities and as a polling station. Most people commute to nearby towns and to Birmingham for employment. A few local jobs are provided by the inns, school, and shops, and the farms and market gardens offer occasasional seasonal work. There are many fund raising activities for church maintenance and charities.
